H0.text: A schism normally refers to a split within what sort of institution. Government

H1.text: A schism normally refers to a split within what sort of institution. Corporation

H2.text: A schism normally refers to a split within what sort of institution. University

H3.text: A schism normally refers to a split within what sort of institution. Church

A4.text: The word is most frequently applied to a split in what had previously been a single religious body, such as the Great Eastâ€“West Schism or the Western Schism.

A5.text: A schism is a division between people, usually belonging to an organization, movement, or religious denomination.

A6.text: Schism is a rejection of communion with the authorities of a Church.

A7.text: In this context, 'schismatic', as a noun, denotes a person who creates or incites schism in a church or a person who is a member of a splinter Church.
